content:
• Thursday, August 1, 2013

  • Overseas markets broadly higher after U.S. rally

    • The Nikkei jumps 1.8%, buoyed by a modestly weaker yen, Sony earnings, and an overnight rally in U.S. shares.
    • The Shanghai Composite and the Hang Seng are 0.4% and 0.62% higher respectively in early trading.
    • In Sidney, stocks rise 0.96%, breaching 5,100 on the ASX, as bank stocks rebound after news of a five basis point deposit levy hurt the sector Thursday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • ONVO

    Organovo announces a public stock offering

    • Organovo Holdings (NASDAQ:ONVO) announces a public offering of a still-to-be-determined number of shares of common stock, with underwriters receiving a 30-day option to purchase shares equal to 15% of the offering to cover possible overallotments.
    • Lazard and Oppenheimer are acting as joint book-runners.
    • Shares -3.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 PM | 6 Comments
  • GNRC

    CCMP Capital to sell its remaining stake in Generac

    • Generac Holdings (NYSE:GNRC) says that funds affiliated with CCMP Capital are planning to sell their remaining 7.02M share stake in a secondary public offering.
    • GNRC will not be selling any stock in the current offering and will not receive any proceeds.
    • Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 PM
  • ALSK

    Alaska Communications: ALSK +17.7% AH on big Q2 beat

    • Alaska Communications' (NASDAQ:ALSK) Q2 revenue rose 8.6% Y/Y and soundly beat estimates, as higher roaming payments fueled a 15.8% Y/Y increase in wireless revenue. Business/wholesale revenue +8.7%, consumer +7.1%, access/CETC -3%.
    • Q2 adjusted EBITDA +32.8% Y/Y to $34M, free cash flow was $15.2M vs. $2.8M a year ago.
    • Wireless subs, business broadband subs, and consumer broadband subs all rose modestly Q/Q. Wireless ARPU +1% Q/Q, business broadband ARPU +4.2%, consumer broadband ARPU +5.9%.
    • 2013 guidance is for revenue of $340M-$350M (below a $350.9M consensus), capex of $50M, and free cash flow of $20M-$25M.
    • Net debt fell by $65M following the closing of the Alaska Wireless Network transaction with General Communications, but still amounts to $444.9M.
    • SA contributor Harry Long has been quite bullish on Alaska on account of the General Communications deal.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • DXI

    Dejour Energy starts production at Kokopelli, shares +15% AH

    • Dejour Energy (DEJ) +15.7% AH on news it has started production of natural gas at its flagship Kokopelli project in Colorado.
    • Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) has completed work under a turnkey contract arrangement, and all four Kokopelli wells will be placed into production by the end of next week.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • ON

    More on ON Semiconductor's earnings

    • ON Semiconductor (ONNN) Q2 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on the top line.
    • Net profit soared from the prior-year period on smaller impairments and lower costs.
    • Looking forward, the company lowers guidance, now expecting revenue for the third quarter to be between $700M and $730M. Analysts had expected $737M.
    • Gross margin narrowed to 33.7% from 34.7%.
    • Shares -7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM
  • SPWR

    SunPower investors take profits, many analysts still bullish

    • Though SunPower (SPWR -13.6%) beat Q2 estimates on the back of better-than-expected margins, and raised its 2013 EPS guidance well above consensus, light revenue figures helped spark a selloff. Also, investors may have decided SunPower's good news was more than priced in following a huge 2013 run-up.
    • Cowen notes SunPower's capacity is fully booked through 2014 and thinks production could grow 20% next year, and Northland expects China's aggressive 2015 solar installation targets to yield strong non-Chinese demand for firms based elsewhere. Lazard is upbeat about European margin expansion and Asia-Pac growth, and Citi observes SunPower's ties to majority owner Total are yielding international deals.
    • Credit Suisse, echoing concerns raised about First Solar, is worried "new utility-scale projects are likely to have lower margins than the current pipeline." Goldman argues a premium valuation and softening earnings growth "suggest headwinds to further upside."
    • U.S. solar peers First Solar (FSLR -2.2%) and SolarCity (SCTY -1.9%) saw modest losses.
    • earnings slides, datasheet, CC transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 7:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming prices 16.5M shares at $12

    • Boyd Gaming (NYSE:BYD) prices 16.5M shares of its previously announced public offering at $12 per share, a 6.3% discount to today's close.
    • Total gross proceeds from the offering will be approximately $198M.
    • Shares -4.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable -7.2% AH due to soft guidance

    • OpenTable's (NASDAQ:OPEN) Q3 guidance is for revenue of $45M-$46.3M and EPS of $0.38-$0.42, below a consensus of $46.5M and $0.48.
    • 2013 guidance is for revenue of $186.2M-$190.1M and EPS of $1.80-$1.92 vs. a consensus of $188M and $1.93.
    • Seated diners +26% Y/Y in Q2 38.2M (+25% in Q1), installed restaurant base grew by 317 Q/Q to 28,274 (grew by 440 in Q1).
    • North American restaurant base +12% Y/Y to 10.6K, international base +15% to 7.7K. 35M North American diners (+25%), still only 3.3M international diners (+46%).
    • Restaurant revenue +24% Y/Y (+21% in Q1), thanks to both diner growth and a promotional pricing change. Subscription revenue +8% (+6% in Q1).
    • Costs/expenses +6% vs. rev. growth of 15%.
    • Q2 results, PR
    • Previous: Rezbook acquisition
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • WPRT

    Westport slips AH on Q2 misses, downward guidance

    • Westport Innovations' (NASDAQ:WPRT) worse than expected Q2 loss was due to a reduction in service and other revenue, higher investments in product development activities, and higher SG&A costs.
    • Lowers FY 2013 guidance, seeing revenues of C$160M-C$180M vs. C$183M consensus and down from prior outlook of C$180M-C$200M, citing the deferral of HPDI-based revenue in China combined with the launch of the Cummins Westport ISX 12G in trucking.
    • Shares -6.5% AH. (Q2 results)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • YY

    YY +18.3% AH on Q2 beat, guidance; Renren, Sina up in sympathy

    • YY's Q3 guidance is for revenue of RMB430M-RMB440M ($70.1M-$71.8M), good for 88%-92% Y/Y growth and well above a consensus of $61.4M.
    • Q2 music services (YY Music) revenue +189% Y/Y to $27.8M (42% of total) thanks to a 174% increase in paid users to 635K.
    • Online game revenue +87% Y/Y to $24.8M.  Paid users +61% to 440K, Q2 ARPU +16% to RMB346 ($56.72).
    • Online ads +42% to $6.9M, other revenue (membership program) +149% to $7.1M.
    • Opex doubled Y/Y to $22.4M thanks to higher R&D and G&A spend. But since gross profit rose 136% Y/Y on the back of 118% rev. growth, op. margin rose to 20.2% from 12.7% a year ago.
    • Chinese social networking peers are up in sympathy. Renren (NYSE:RENN) +2.8% AH after soaring 19.5% in regular trading in the absence of major news. Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) +0.8% after rising 6.8% thanks to Alibaba's moves.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • WTW

    More on Weight Watchers earnings

    • Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW) Q2 beats on revenue, but net earnings fell 16% on a a $20M debt-refinancing charge.
    • Revenue in the weight-loss meetings business was especially weak as it experienced declining volumes globally, most notably in North America and the United Kingdom.
    • Total paid weeks -2.5% Y/Y, online paid weeks +4.4%, meeting paid weeks -10.4%.
    • Looking forward, the company issues downside guidance for FY13, lowering its EPS expectations to between $3.55 - 3.70 from $3.60 - 3.90. Street consensus is for $3.70.
    • CEO David Kirchhoff resigns to pursue other opportunities. He will be succeeded as CEO by President and COO James Chambers, who joined the company in January.
    • Shares -15.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 2 Comments

  • After-hours top gainers / Losers

    • After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: IRDM +23%. MELI +17%. SSNI +17%. ALSK +11%. YY +8%.
    • losers: EMAN -18%. ADNC -17%. VCLK -16%. SFM -13%. PCRX -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • WPRT

    Westport misses by $0.11, misses on revenue

    • Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT): Q2 EPS of -$0.61 misses by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $35M (-28.9% Y/Y) misses by $9M.
    • Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • TLAB

    Tellabs beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Tellabs (NASDAQ:TLAB): Q2 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $212M beats by $1.66M. Shares +2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • INVA

    FDA panel to discuss Theravance's Anoro Ellipta in September

    • Theravance (THRX) says the FDA's Pulmonary-Allergy Drugs Advisory Committee will discuss the company's NDA for the COPD treatment Anoro Ellipta on September 10. (PR)
    • Shares +1.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • LF

    More on Leapfrog earnings

    • LeapFrog (NYSE:LF) Q2 beats on lower than anticipated per share losses and better total sales.
    • Sales growth was largely driven by its LeapPad learning tablet and LeapReader reading-and-writing lines, which benefited from new products being shipped to retailers for summer 2013 launches.
    • Net sales increased 16% Y/Y; U.S. segment +19%, international +10%.
    • Loss from operations improved by 34%.
    • For Q3, sales are seen increasing in the mid-to-high single-digit percentage growth rate compared to Q3 last year. EPS is seen at $0.32. The Street is at $0.34 per share.
    • Shares +1.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 3 Comments
  • ACTV

    Active Network receives "expressions of interest," shares +32.1% AH

    • Active Network (NYSE:ACTV) says it has " received expressions of interest from outside parties ranging from an investment ... to an acquisition." The board has created a committee to evaluate its options.
    • Though investors are naturally more interested in other matters, Active's guidance is light. Q3 guidance is for revenue of $113M-$116M and a net loss of $4M-$9M, worse than a consensus of $121.6M in revenue and EPS of $0.01. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $451M-$456M and a net loss of $35M-$41M vs. a revenue/EPS consensus of $462.7M and -$0.18.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • ADNC

    Audience -18.6% AH on light guidance, smartphone trends blamed

    • Audience (NASDAQ:ADNC) expects Q3 revenue of $31M-$34M and EPS of -$0.09 to -$0.13, well below a consensus of $44.9M and $0.15.
    • The audio processing chip/IP developer says it sees "shifting trends in the smartphone market that will present both challenges and opportunities."
    • As with Atmel's guidance, Samsung's Galaxy S4 production cuts could be responsible. An Audience processor is found inside Samsung's flagship device.
    • Beyond the S4, there has been a demand shift towards low-end/mid-range phones, where Audience's voice-enhancing processors are sometimes a tougher sell to OEMs.
    • Q2 R&D spend +30% to $10.3M, SG&A +32% to $10.8M. Rev. growth was 36%.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro beats by $0.10, beats on revenue

    • Tesoro (TSO): Q2 EPS of $1.56, beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue $8.9B, beats by $1.1B. (PR)
    • Shares +0.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • SSNI

    Silver Spring Networks beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Silver Spring Networks (NYSE:SSNI): Q2 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $103.5M beats by $23.9M. Shares +16.89% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • MRC

    MRC Global beats by $0.05, misses on revenue

    • MRC Global (NYSE:MRC): Q2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $1.27B misses by $0.04B. Shares -6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • YY

    YY beats by $0.13, beats on revenue

    • YY (NASDAQ:YY): Q2 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.13.
    • Revenue of $66.6M (+117.8% Y/Y) beats by $11M. Shares +8.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • AIG

    More on AIG earnings and capital return

    • Book value per share (excluding AOCI) of $61.25 up 11% Y/Y, but off 2% from Q1 thanks to marks on higher interest rates.
    • AIG P&C and AIG Life paid $1.3B to parent in dividends and loan repayments in Q2.
    • P&C operating income of $1.1B up 17.5% Y/Y. Adjusted combined ratio (excludes catastrophes) improves to 96.5 from 98.3. Adjusted net premiums written of $9.3B up 4%. Commercial net premiums written up 3.6%.
    • Life & Retirement operating income of $1.2B up 23% Y/Y. Net investment income of $2.6B up 5%. AUM up 10% to $294B.
    • United Guaranty (mortgage insurance) operating income of $73M up 70%, benefitting from commutations, settlements, and reserve releases. Net premiums written of $275M up 30%.
    • Dividend of $0.10/share is a yield of less than 1% annualized (assuming quarterly payment). Buyback of $1B represents about 1.5% of the float at today's closing price.
    • Earlier: Earnings report and capital return announcement.
    • Earnings call tomorrow at 8 ET. (PR)
    • AIG +5.1% AH to $49.46.
    • AIG's TARP warrants - struck at $45 and expiring in 2021 - are ahead 5.9% to $20.50 in AH trade.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn now +7.9% AH following Q2 beat, jobs and subscriptions strong

    • Talent Solutions (jobs) sales +69% Y/Y in Q2 vs. +80% in Q1 and 56% of revenue. Ads were softer due to sponsored news feed transition, +36% Y/Y vs. +56% in Q1 and 24% of revenue. Subscriptions +68% vs. +73% in Q1 and 20% of revenue.
    • Investors are taking revenue guidance in stride in light of the ad transition and LinkedIn's (LNKD) history of guiding conservatively.
    • 2013 adjusted EBITDA guidance range raised by $10M to $340M-$355M.
    • U.S. 62% of Q2 sales, even with Q1. Field sales 58% of revenue, direct (online) sales 42%.
    • Registered users +9% Q/Q and +37% Y/Y to 238M.
    • ComScore estimates monthly unique visitors (exc. mobile) rose 8% Q/Q and 34% Y/Y to 143M, page views 5% Q/Q and 26% Y/Y to 11.7B.
    • Q2 results, PR, slides
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas beats by $0.04, misses on revenue

    • Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q2 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.04; includes $0.05 from non-cash hedging activities.
    • Revenue of $173M (+102.3% Y/Y) misses by $8M.
    • Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • WPZ

    Williams Partners announces 21.5M-unit offering

    • Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) -4% AH after announcing a public offering of 21.5M common units.
    • WPZ plans to use the proceeds to pay down debt, to fund capital expenditures and for general partnership purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics beats by $0.15, beats on revenue

    • Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA): FQ4 EPS of $1.39 beats by $0.15.
    • Revenue of $230.2M (+67% Y/Y) beats by $1.51M. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • AIG

    AIG begins capital returns with dividend and buyback

    • AIG's board declares a dividend of $0.10/share and authorizes a $1B buyback - "The announced actions were approved without assuming a sale of ILFC."
    • Shares +5.6% AH. (PR)
    • Earlier: Earnings report.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 7 Comments
  • ACTV

    Active Network beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Active Network (NYSE:ACTV): Q2 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $132.4M (+9% Y/Y) beats by $1.5M. Shares +8.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • MELI

    Market cheers MercadoLibre results

    • MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI) skyrockets in late trading after Q2 EPS and revenue beat estimates.
    • Net revenues, total payments, and gross merchandise volume rise 38%, 54%, and 45% respectively during the quarter (all on constant currency basis).
    • On a USD basis — which is how critics including Barron's say the results should be judged — net revenues were up 26.3% Y/Y.
    • Number of items sold increases 27.1%
    • Operating margin falls 430 bps Y/Y, but rises on a sequential basis. Shares +21% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • RMD

    ResMed EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • ResMed (NYSE:RMD): FQ4 EPS of $0.62 in-line.
    • Revenue of $414.6M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $3.71M. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • LF

    Leapfrog Q2 EPS beats by $0.03, revenue beats

    • Leapfrog (NYSE:LF): Q2 EPS loss of $0.05 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $83M beats by $5.81M. (PR)
    • Shares +1.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers EPS of $1.39, beats on revenue

    • Weight Watchers (NYSE:WTW): Q2 EPS of $1.39.
    • Revenue of $465.1M beats by $5.76M. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • ON

    ON Semiconductor EPS in-line, misses on revenue

    • ON Semiconductor (ONNN): Q2 EPS of $0.13 in-line.
    • Revenue of $688.3M misses by $7.8M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • MELI

    MercadoLibre beats, shares soar

    • MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI): Q2 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $112.2M beats by $4.58M. Shares +24% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • EGN

    Energen posts solid Q2 earnings beat, UBS raises its price target to $67

    • Energen (EGN +10.5%) moves up today on a solid Q2 earnings beat.
    • Net earnings fell 37% Y/Y on higher costs, however, as gains in operating revenue were offset by higher costs.
    • The company lowered its FY13 view, now expecting an EPS of $3.15 to $3.55, citing increased estimates for lease operating expenses and slight changes to product mix, from its prior view of $3.34 to $3.74 a share.
    • UBS raises their price target to $67 from $60 on the back of the report, citing strong upper Wolfcamp results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • INT

    Oil explosion in Quebec train crash "abnormal," World Fuel shares sink

    • Canadian investigators say the violent explosions in last month's Quebec train derailment would be an "abnormal" reaction for crude oil, so the probe into the disaster likely will continue for months.
    • Doubts are raised about the nature of the petroleum cargo on the runaway train, which was listed as hauling 50K barrels of crude oil.
    • The Quebec government has ordered the privately owned railway and fuel transport provider World Fuel Services (INT -5.9%) to finance the cleanup; INT has questioned the legality of the order.
    • INT shares had opened higher, as Q2 earnings and revenues beat estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • ALPMY

    Xtandi sales weigh on Medivation

    • As reported here earlier, Astellas Pharma's (OTCPK:ALPMY +1%) quarterly report showed Xtandi sales of $82M. That's short of consensus and bad news for partner Medivation (MDVN -1.3%).
    • More color: William Blair's forecast was for sales of $85.2M (so a big miss there) — Astellas' full year Xtandi sales guidance of $400M is well below the firm's estimate of $459M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • BGCP

    Profit-taking in BGC Partners following earnings

    • BGC Partners (BGCP -5.4%) post-tax distributable earnings of $0.13 is about inline with consensus and off 23.5% from a year ago. Revenue of $471.1M is up 1.3% Y/Y.
    • 77.4M shares repurchased at end of Q2; 45.2M will be issued to partners.
    • Company anticipates still having about $459M cash remaining from eSpeed sale - will be used to repay debt, make acquisitions, invest in organic growth, or repurchase additional shares.
    • Q3 revenue outlook of $410M-$440M vs. $445.7M in Q3 2012. Pre-tax earnings of $36M-$46M vs. $46.7M in Q3 2012.
    • Earlier: Earnings report. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • HOS

    Hornbeck Offshore surges after Q2 profit nearly doubles

    • Hornbeck Offshore Services (HOS +9%) powers higher after Q2 profit nearly doubled, and results beat earnings and revenue estimates.
    • Upstream revenue rose 13% to $138M, driven by growth in vessel revenues from higher utilization and day rates; upstream operating income jumped 32% to $47M.
    • Last week's sale of its downstream fleet of tug boats and oil-transport barges to Genesis Marine, part of HOS' shift to emphasize its core E&P business, is expected to result in a $38.4M after-tax gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • STAA

    STAAR Surgical jumps on upbeat guidance

    • STAAR Surgical (STAA +18.5%) soars following the company's Q2 report.
    • Visian ICL sales rise 31% Y/Y to $11.3M, mostly comprised of unit sales growth (as opposed to price increases).
    • IOL revenue falls by ~1% Y/Y on a constant currency basis.
    • Outlook: Full year revenue growth of 12-14% versus previous guidance of 8-10%, gross margin expansion of at least 250 bps, and GAAP profitability in every quarter. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • BXE

    Bellatrix agrees to sell 50% stake in Alberta assets

    • Bellatrix Exploration (BXE +5.3%) enters a joint venture deal under which it will sell a 50% working interest in certain Alberta assets to Daewoo International and Devonian Natural Resources for C$52.5M.
    • BXE plans to use proceeds from the sale to reduce debt and ultimately direct them to the continued development of its Cardium and Mannville asset base.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • BCRX

    BioCryst up as FDA removes clincal hold

    • The FDA removes the clinical hold on BioCryst's (BCRX +24.8%) HAE treatment BCX-4161. The company can now initiate clinical trials in the U.S.
    • The news might well be weighing on ViroPharma (VPHM -7.2%) whose Cinryze helps prevent HAE attacks. Some analysts say BCX-4161 poses no near-term threat to VPHM.
    • This is the second piece of Cinryze-related news today. VPHM's discontinuation of a Phase 2 trial involving the drug and Halozyme's rHuPH20 has HALO shares under quite a bit of pressure.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • OCN

    Ocwen management suggests share repurchases

    • Already higher following a big earnings report, Ocwen Financial (OCN +6.8%) kicks into another gear as management - on the earnings call - holds out the potential for a stock buyback.
    • Noting new opportunities will always be priority #1, CFO John Britti says the company is near a point where it can finance both growth and capital returns. He says the company could repurchase up to $900M of stock (more than 10% of the float at today's price) now without generating adverse tax consequences and that number should grow over time.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • CHK

    Investors cheer Chesapeake's new fiscal discipline, asset review

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK +7%) CEO Doug Lawler says in the earnings call that a comprehensive review of the company's partnerships and assets is underway, with the general aim is to "reduce the complexity and provide better clarity on where we are getting our best returns."
    • On CHK's new-found fiscal discipline - reduced capex plans and only $100M spent YTD on undeveloped land - Morningstar's Mark Hanson says "new Chesapeake wouldn't recognize old Chesapeake if they passed each other on the street."
    • Shares hit a new 52-week high of $25.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • PH

    Parker Hannifin rises on Stifel upgrade

    • Stifel Nicolaus analyst Nathan Jones raises his estimates for Parker Hannifin (PH +3.5%) citing an end to destocking by OEM customers and a stabilizing European manufacturing sector. One wonders if one PMI print above 50 means "stabilization."
    • Offsetting factors include a "push-out to calendar 2014 of any reacceleration of the Chinese economy."
    • PH's balance sheet "is in a very strong position with net debt to EBITDA of only 0.5x," Jones says, which will give the company "the flexibility to pursue accretive acquisitions or share repurchases."
    • Price target hiked to $118 from $104.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • HNGR

    Hanger dips on profit miss

    • Hanger (HGR -15.7%) tumbles after missing on the bottom line with its Q2 report.
    • Same-center sales growth comes in at 3.9% for the period.
    • CEO Vinit Asar is "not satisfied" with HGR's earnings but says the company's "overall sales performance" was decent considering the macroeconomic environment.
    • Employee benefits, sequestration, and other factors dent operating margins to the tune of 100 bps.
    • FY13 outlook: $2.07-2.13/ share on revenue of $1.06-1.08B, straddling consensus. (PR)
    • CJS Securities downgrades the shares to Market Perform (PT, $35).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • E

    Eni profit cut 55% in Q2 but sees better second half

    • Eni (E +2.6%) is higher, despite a 55% drop in Q2 adjusted net profit to €576M from €1.29B in the year-ago period; analysts had expected €703M.
    • Net sales from operations were €28.1B vs. €30.1B.
    • Production flat at 1.64B boe/day vs. 1.65B a year ago.
    • Expects a "significant" improvement in H2 results; forecasts 2013 hydrocarbon output in line with last year, while gas sales are expected to drop.
